intro: Gahnia vitiensis subsp. kauaiensis, commonly known as the Kauai grass, is a tussock-forming plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in wet, lowland areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which are often green or reddish in color. This subspecies is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and limited distribution.
